enigma.console
Interface Console

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultConsoleImpl, RemoteConsoleServer
public interface Console

A Console is a high-level text component, equivalent to an xterm window in Unix. Console provides functionality such as text editing, command recall, and interfaces to streams and writers. The default implementation of Console uses a pluggable TextWindow for its low-level text support.

Author:
Ethan Royael Nicholas (ethan@ethannicholas.com)
See Also:
DefaultConsoleImpl
Status:
STABLE. No incompatible changes will be made in the future.

Method Detail

getTitle

public String getTitle()
Returns the title of this console. Not all Console implementations will display the title for users to see.

See Also:
setTitle(java.lang.String)

setTitle

public void setTitle(String title)
Sets the title of this console. Not all Console implementations will display the title for users to see.

See Also:
getTitle()

readLine

public String readLine()
Enters edit mode and reads a line of text. Returns the entered line (which may be of arbitrary length) when the user presses the Enter or Return key.

readPassword

public String readPassword()
Enters edit mode and reads a line of text, echoing asterisks ('*') instead of the characters the user is typing. Returns the entered line (which may be of arbitrary length) when the user presses the Enter or Return key.

getReader

public Reader getReader()
Returns a Reader which returns characters typed into this console. As with System.in.readLine(), editing is supported and text is not delivered until the user has pressed the Enter or Return key.

Returns:
an Reader which reads from this console
See Also:
getWriter(), getInputStream(), getOutputStream()

getWriter

public PrintWriter getWriter()
Returns a PrintWriter which sends its output to this console.

Returns:
a PrintWriter which sends its output to this console
See Also:
getReader(), getInputStream(), getOutputStream()

getInputStream

public InputStream getInputStream()
Returns an InputStream which returns characters typed into this console. As with System.in.readLine(), editing is supported and text is not delivered until the user has pressed the Enter or Return key.

Returns:
an InputStream which reads from this console
See Also:
getOutputStream(), getReader(), getWriter()

getOutputStream

public PrintStream getOutputStream()
Returns a PrintWriter which sends its output to this console.

Returns:
a PrintWriter which sends its output to this console
See Also:
getInputStream(), getReader(), getWriter()

isTextWindowAvailable

public boolean isTextWindowAvailable()
Consoles generally also provide access to the low-level TextWindow API, but they are not required to. isTextWindowAvailable returns true if getTextWindow will succeed, false if it will throw a TextWindowNotAvailableException.

Returns:
true if TextWindow support is available, false otherwise

getTextWindow

public TextWindow getTextWindow()
                         throws TextWindowNotAvailableException
Returns the TextWindow to which this console is attached. Consoles will generally provide TextWindow support, but are not required to. You may check for TextWindow availability using isTextWindowAvailable(). If no TextWindow is available, getTextWindow will throw TextWindowNotAvailableException.

Returns:
the TextWindow this console is managing, or null if none
Throws:
TextWindowNotAvailableException - if this console does not provide a TextWindow

getTextAttributes

public TextAttributes getTextAttributes()
Returns the TextAttributes which will be applied to any data sent to this console via its associated PrintStream or PrintWriter.

Returns:
the TextAttributes currently in effect
See Also:
setTextAttributes(enigma.console.TextAttributes), getOutputStream(), getWriter(), TextWindow

setTextAttributes

public void setTextAttributes(TextAttributes attributes)
Sets the TextAttributes which will be applied to any data sent to this console via its associated PrintStream or PrintWriter.

Parameters:
attributes - the TextAttributes to apply to output
Throws:
NullPointerException - if attributes is null
See Also:
getTextAttributes(), getOutputStream(), getWriter(), TextWindow
